Welcome to VisIt's release notes page. This page describes the important enhancements and bug-fixes that were added to this release.

Bugs fixed in version 3.0.2

  • Corrected a bug where VisIt would crash when attempting to use python expressions with other expressions as inputs.
  • Fixed launch failure on Windows when 8dot3name (shortnames) is disabled on the system.
  • Fixed issue with the mili plugin not handling integers in scientific notation.

Enhancements in version 3.0.2

  • Host profiles were added for the Oak Ridge National Laboratory's Summit system.
  • Tables in the GUI doc that ran off the edge of the page have been converted to definition lists.
  • Modified the batch launching at NERSC to work on Cori after the major operating system upgrade."
  • Openssl was added to the list of required libraries in build_visit.
  • Added the turbo color table.
  • XYZ Writer repalces '?' with UNKNOWN_ATOMIC_ELEMENT and now warns user if dataset is not effectively point-centered.
  • Xdmf reader now supports time-varying grid count via top-level <Information Name="TimeVaryingMetaData" Value="True"/> node in the xdmf file.

Changes for VisIt developers in version 3.0.2

  • Updated masonry to build adios2 for OSX.
  • Fixed building plugins against a VisIt install for OSX.
  • Fixed xmledit failure due to missing QT cocoa plugin.
  • Fixed the libxml2 image not found error when loading the uintah database.
  • PySide was removed from build_visit until we get a newer version working with VisIt.

For any additional questions, send e-mail to VisIt Users.
